result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark P Lovvik

records.addlTxt: 10:52 AM cases 22CM519, 22TR4454, 22TR5657 called. Prosecuting Attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark P Lovvik not in court. State moves to default defendant on 22TR4454 OWI 1st and dismiss and read in any other charges. Court approves states motion. Court finds the defendant guilty and orders $811.50, 6 month driver's license revocation, AODA and follow through with recommendations and one warrant fee. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores.

(Case called at 11:34 am.)  Court Commissioner Wendy Sue Johnson for Branch 4
Defendant appeared in person without counsel  State by DDA Angela Beranek.
Defendant advised of charges and potential penalties.  Warrant Quashed.  Pretrial Conference:  07-13-22 at 1:15 pm.  Hearing:  08-04-22 at 9:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores.

(Case called at 11:10 AM) No appearance by Defendant Mark Lovvik in person or by Zoom. ADA Afton Lewis appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
State has no information on Defendant's non-appearance and requests warrant.  
Court orders warrant- $100 or body only.
